definition: common factor/common divisor (of a math. expression)

public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)

sentences.english: Only the resultant matrix is needed to solve the greatest common factor of polynomials …
sentences.chinese: 該方法僅利用結矩陣便可求得多項式的最大公因式。

sentences.english: Only the resultant matrix is needed to solve the greatest common factor of polynomials in this method.
sentences.chinese: 該方法僅利用結矩陣便可求得多項式的最大公因式。

sentences.english: And now a new method-equivalence change is given in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 給出了另一種求最大公因式的方法，即等效變換法。

sentences.english: Thereby we break a new path to find the greatest common factor of polynomials .
sentences.chinese: 從而開闢了一條求解多項式最大公因式的新途徑。

sentences.english: A new method to solve the greatest common factor of one variable polynomials is proposed.
sentences.chinese: 給出一種求解一元多項式的最大公因式新方法。

definition: reduced fraction (e.g. one half for three sixths)/to reduce a fraction by canceling common factors in the numerator and denominator
elimination (math)/to eliminate one variable from equations
